thread.title: People Are Not Happy That The White House Blocked Major News Outlets from a Press Briefing
thread.title_full: People Are Not Happy That The White House Blocked Major News Outlets from a Press Briefing

author: Erica Gonzales
title: People Are Not Happy That The White House Blocked Major News Outlets from a Press Briefing
text:
This afternoon, several news outlets‚Äîincluding the New York Times , CNN, LA Times and Politico‚Äîwere barred from attending a White House media gaggle (a less formal press briefing without cameras). Meanwhile, journalists form conservative outlets like Steve Bannon's Breitbart News, One America News Network and The Washington Times were allowed to attend, NYT reports . Other organizations such as Fox News, ABC, CBS, The Wall Street Journal , and Bloomberg also attended. The unusual action, made by Press Secretary Sean Spicer, marks a stark rift in the White House's relationship with the news media and comes off as a breach of the first amendment, which protects freedom of the press.
Angered journalists, politicians and citizens made their feelings known on Twitter.
White House BANS CNN from covering a press briefing - says they are "not on the list" This will hurt Trump more then help pic.twitter.com/r8Ck8NdOMb
‚Äî Stop Trump üç∑ (@StopTrump2020) February 24, 2017
